channel.title: Recolouring items (delta)

item.title: Recolouring items (delta)
item.dc:creator: @zzjimmy zzjimmy
item.description:
@zzjimmy wrote:

ok i found what I assume is the original colour (61) but it still doesnt change when I wear the item. I know that the statement is corect because i get no errors and the description works in game. So either 61 still isn’t the right colour or is there’s something else that could be wrong?

Read full topic

item.title: Recolouring items (delta)
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

The element of the array anIntArray156, what does it correspond to?

Read full topic

item.title: Recolouring items (delta)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

I cannot guarentee this will work 100% but if you can manage to unpack the model from your cache. You may be able to covert it to MQO format using a tool called Datmaker. You can open this MQO file using Metasequoia to get the color ID’s that RS would be using. The numbers may be slightly off, meaning 2-3 higher or lower at most, but it will give you a great idea of where to start.

Read full topic

ok thanks a lot man and could you happen to have the original colour for dragon chainbody?

item.title: Recolouring items (delta)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

anIntArray156 is what color you want to change.
anIntArray160 is what color you are changing it to.

Read full topic

item.title: Recolouring items (delta)
item.dc:creator: @zzjimmy zzjimmy
item.description:
@zzjimmy wrote:

I supposedly recoloured my dragon chainbody but when I log in and wear it, it’s still the default colour. Here is the code:

if(i == 3140) //ID { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.aString170 = "Dragon chainbody"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Made from the finest dragon scales.".getBytes(); //Description class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 0x007f; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 0x007f; class8.anInt174 = 3823; class8.anInt181 = 1100; class8.anInt190 = 568; class8.anInt198 = 0; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 0; class8.anInt194 = 2; class8.anInt165 = 3820; class8.anInt200 = 3821; class8.anInt188 = 156; class8.anInt164 = 337; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1;

0x007f is the colour code.

Read full topic
